Detailed Description

This class is used for storing parameters loaded from *.params or text file.

format of *.params file is the following: <Attribute name> : {Attribute value}. Comments of the following format are allowed // or /* */. For description of existing attributes see file input.params and Main Page.

Member Function Documentation

void Params::addParameter ( const std::string &  field,
const std::string &  value 
)

Saves a given attribute and its value in internal data structure. All attributes are assumed to be unique. If an existing attribute is attempted to be added, an error is thrown.

std::string Params::getAutoFileName ( char  del = '_')

Generates auto-name for a file using the following format: NetName_Algorithm_Equilibration_Approach_LineSearch_NEWTON_STEPS_ShPathAlgo

  • bi-objective shortest paths parameters if any. The default delimiter is _. If one of the attributes is not given, they will be skipped.
std::string Params::getParam ( const std::string &  name)
Returns
value of a given attribute name in a string format. If the given attribute does not exist, an error is thrown.
std::string Params::getParamWoSpaces ( const std::string &  name)

Same as getParam(), but the returned string is without any white spaces.

void Params::print ( )

Prints all attributes and their corresponding values on screen.
